movies.title: Der blinde Fleck
movies.plot: The true story of a journalist who investigates the backgrounds of the Oktoberfest terror attack of 1980.
movies.simplePlot: The true story of a journalist who investigates the backgrounds of the Oktoberfest terror attack of 1980.

biography.bio: Benno Fürmann was born on 17 January 1972 in Berlin, Germany and worked as a waiter, bouncer and drifter before attending acting lessons at the Lee Strasberg Institute in New York. After returning to Germany, he played several minor parts in movie and television projects until his breakthrough performance in Die Bubi Scholz Story (1998). In recent years, he appeared in critically acclaimed TV movies (Wolfsburg (2003)) as well as international productions such as Joyeux Noel (2005).
biography.name: Benno Fürmann

biography.bio: Nicolette Krebitz was born on September 2, 1972 in Berlin, Germany. She is an actress and director, known for Le tunnel (2001), Bandits (1997) and High Maintenance (2006).
biography.name: Nicolette Krebitz

biography.bio: Heiner Lauterbach was born on April 10, 1953 in Cologne, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. He is an actor and director, known for Men... (1985), The Experiment (2001) and Der Skorpion (1997). He has been married to Viktoria Lauterbach since September 8, 2001. They have two children. He was previously married to Katja Flint.
biography.name: Heiner Lauterbach

biography.bio: Jörg Hartmann was born on June 8, 1970 in Hagen, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. He is an actor, known for Das Ende der Geduld (2014), Das Ende einer Nacht (2012) and Tatort (1970).
biography.name: Jörg Hartmann

biography.bio: Born in the USA. His father, a Jewish immigrant, was head of the Opera Department of the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign in Illinois. The Zirners lived on Burlison Drive in Urbana, Illinois. Back in Europe Zirner studied at the "Max-Reinhardt-Seminar". Lives with his spouse, actress Katalin Zsigmondy, and their four children at the Chiemsee.
biography.name: August Zirner

biography.bio: Udo Wachtveitl was born on October 21, 1958 in Munich, Bavaria, West Germany. He is an actor and director, known for Tatort (1970), The Shared Happiness (2010) and Meister des Todes (2015).
biography.name: Udo Wachtveitl

biography.bio: Miroslav Nemec was born on June 26, 1954 in Zagreb, Croatia, Yugoslavia. He is an actor, known for Tatort (1970), Der blinde Fleck (2013) and Tricked (2000).
biography.name: Miroslav Nemec

biography.bio: Isolde Barth was born on August 24, 1948. She is an actress and production manager, known for The Marriage of Maria Braun (1979), Merci pour le Chocolat (2000) and Kronos. End and Beginning (2008).
biography.name: Isolde Barth

biography.bio: Anna Grisebach was born on March 20, 1974 in Göttingen, Lower Saxony, Germany. She is an actress, known for Bright Night (2014), Koslowski & Haferkamp (2014) and Der blinde Fleck (2013).
biography.name: Anna Grisebach

biography.bio: Walter Hess is an actor, known for Sophie Scholl: The Final Days (2005), Der Bananenkaktus (2004) and Agnes (2016).
biography.name: Walter Hess

biography.bio: Michael Jäger was born on August 23, 1966 in Kaiserslautern, Germany. He is an actor, known for Der blinde Fleck (2013), Trenck l'insoumis (2003) and Marienhof (1992).
biography.name: Michael Jäger

biography.bio: Simone Kabst was born on June 21, 1973 in Leipzig, German Democratic Republic. She is an actress, known for According to the Plan (2007), Der blinde Fleck (2013) and Fürst Pückler Playboy, Pascha, Visionär (2015).
biography.name: Simone Kabst

biography.bio: Tessa Mittelstaedt was born on April 1, 1974 in Ulm, Baden-Württemberg, Germany. She is an actress, known for Morden im Norden (2012), Tatort (1970) and Der Fürst und das Mädchen (2003).
biography.name: Tessa Mittelstaedt

biography.bio: Olaf Krätke was the youngest of three children. His father (actor) and mother (actress) worked at the Dortmunder Schauspielhaus. His career as actor began modestly in a small role in the play "Pinocchio" at the Dortmunder Schauspielhaus in 1965. He joined the drama program of his father and one of his colleagues. Krätke grew up in Dortmund and went then to Bavaria, when his father retired from stage and after the death of his mother. The very intensive private drama program ended with the death of his father in 1984. His first professional stage appearance was as police Inspector in the 1979 independent production "H - Ein Fixer gerät in die Mühlen der Justiz". Between 1976 and 1979 he done a training as professional photographer, as his father wished. His film career began with the main role as "The stiff man" in the surrealistic short "The Banquet" in 1983, which he also directed. Between 1983 and 1985 he directed three shorts, one feature film and two full length documentaries for a British film production company. Till 2003 he appeared only on stage. In 2004 Krätke returned back on television in some doc-dramas and an episode of the ZDF series "Wilsberg - Schuld und Sühne" and also on screen in the feature films "Streetwise" and "Adam Meets Eve". After some small roles in series like "Freunde für immer" (directed by Sönke Wortmann), he got his first main role in 2005 as Dr. Klaus Bernreiter in the thriller "Rollentausch". Scince than he become more and more popular and in several feature films like "Blutsbande", "GG 19", "Er schon wieder" and "Zimmer im Spiegel" (with Konstantin Wecker) and on television in successful series like "Um Himmels Willen" as Dr. Paul Hofer, or "Salvator Singspiel am Nockherberg" ("Trauminsel Nockherberg" 2006, "Staatszirkus Nockherberg" 2007) and the tv - comedy "Gwendolyn" (Bayerisches Fernsehen). In 2006 he gave his debut in his first international feature film production "Schlimmer geht's nimmer", a comedy which was shoot in Austria (Styria) and Trieste (Italy). On September 2007 he played the role of Dr. Schmidt, the head of the medical institute IXAM, in the Hollywood production "Testing Life", which was directed by Carolin von Petzholdt.
biography.name: Olaf Krätke

biography.bio: Ferdinand Schmidt-Modrow was born on April 30, 1985 in Aichach, Bavaria, Germany. He is an actor, known for The Wave (2008), On n'en a pas (2012) and Beste Gegend (2008).
biography.name: Ferdinand Schmidt-Modrow

awards.award: Guild of German Art House Cinemas 2013
